page.title: 06FARMING part 2
page.content: The Deer Park Wood is used as part of a tourist amenity, the Roe Valley Country Park. About half of the land is used for grazing and silage growing. The animals mainly grazed are beef cattle and sheep though there are some large dairy herds just outside our area (700 cattle in one herd). About one third of the land is used for crops mainly barley, wheat and potatoes. In recent years oil seed rape has become very popular and several large fields have been planted this year. The seed is harvested at the end of July by combine harvesters, the stalk is burned and the seed crushed to produce vegetable oil and then margarine.
